title: AFL‚Äôs biggest troll, Cooney junior‚Äôs harsh advice

organizations.name: news corp australia  the number  north melbourne

text:
Source: FOX SPORTS HERE‚Äôs a question ‚Äî who is your favourite AFL player to watch? 
There are plenty of standard answers you could give. Patrick Dangerfield, Nat Fyfe and Gary Ablett, just to name a few. 
In the AFL Record for Sunday‚Äôs clash between North Melbourne and the West Coast Eagles, two players were asked that question and many more in their ‚Äòpocket profiles‚Äô. 
Eagle Andrew Gaff played a straight bat in his interview. He likes watching Ablett, loved David Neitz as a kid and wants to travel the world when he retires. 
But young Kangaroo Kayne Turner sounded more like a Reddit user or Facebook commenter in his answers. 
His favourite player to watch? Zac Dawson, of course. 
His favourite player of all-time? None other than Richmond two-gamer and one-time SuperCoach heart-throb Relton Roberts. 
Turner would love to meet Po, Laa-Laa and Tinky-Winky from the Teletubbies ‚Äî but not Dipsy, obviously ‚Äî and next on his travel bucket list is Devonport. 
Although Gaff said if he could have any band play at the Grand Final it would be Nickelback, so perhaps he is the biggest troll of all. 
You can enjoy Turner‚Äôs full set of answers below. Either way, AFL Confidential has a new favourite player. 
LISTEN TO THE LATEST FOX FOOTY PODCAST BELOW, OR TAP HERE TO SUBSCRIBE IN ITUNES Kayne Turner's answers in his Footy Record interview. Source: Supplied More of Kayne Turner's answers in his Footy Record interview. Source: Supplied 
THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT PLS RETWEET 
WAS Fremantle wearing the wrong colour in Round 1? 
AFL Confidential noticed a strange difference in tone between the purples on their guernseys and their shorts during the loss to Geelong. 
Just take a look at these photos from Sunday. That‚Äôs a lighter purple on the top, isn‚Äôt it? (Photo by Paul Kane/Getty Images) Source: Getty Images Look at Sandi. This isn‚Äôt crazy, is it? (Photo by Paul Kane/Getty Images) Source: Getty Images Again! Look! (Photo by Will Russell/AFL Media/Getty Images) Source: Getty Images 
The only explanation AFL Confidential can come up with is that the guernseys, which were special charity tops for the Starlight Foundation, are actually a bit lighter? 
For comparison‚Äôs sake here's a photo of Fremantle‚Äôs normal look from the JLT series. That‚Äôs totally a darker purple. (Photo by Paul Kane/Getty Images) Source: Getty Images 
More on this important story never.

KIDS SAY THE DARNDEST THINGS 
THIS seems a bit harsh from Adam Cooney‚Äôs son Jaxon. 
A tweet from Haylea Cooney has revealed what Jaxon really thinks of his dad‚Äôs footy career. Jax just said me to "Mum whenever Dad leaves a team they get good... whenever he is playing, the team is terrible" üòÇüòÇ cop that @Adamcooney17 
‚ÄúMum whenever Dad leaves a team they get good... whenever he is playing, the team is terrible,‚Äù the youngster said. 
Ouch. 
‚ÄòTHIS IS YOUR CAPTAIN SPEAKING... GO CROWS‚Äô 
IT was a heck of a weekend for footy in South Australia, with Port Adelaide surprising in a win over Sydney Swans. 
But the Adelaide Crows took the instate chocolates by beating the premiership favourites in both the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs leagues. The men‚Äôs team downed GWS on Sunday and the AFLW side beat the Brisbane Lions for the premiership. 
One of the Crows‚Äô victorious captains was Chelsea Randall, but it appears her captaincy was so successful it also applies to air travel. ‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) March 26, 2017 
THE BORING TWEET OF THE WEEK AWARD, PRESENTED BY JAMES HARMES 
AND the winner is... Max Gawn, for: ‚ÄúWell played Lachie hunter.‚Äù 
He got so bored during the tweet he couldn‚Äôt even be bothered to capitalise Hunter. Well played Lachie hunter. ‚Äî Max Gawn (@gawndog37) March 24, 2017 @gawndog37 boring tweet award to you this week max ‚Äî james harmes (@jamesharmes) March 25, 2017 
A PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT FOR SCOTT LYCETT 
HEY, Scott Lycett. 
Someone hacked your Twitter account. You‚Äôre retweeting advertisements in Arabic for people to buy Instagram and Twitter followers. 
Change your password. 
PHOTO OF THE WEEK This whole China thing just isn‚Äôt working for Kochie. Here he is with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and PM Malcolm Turnbull and, unfortunately for the Port Adelaide chairman, two club scarfs. Photo: Phil Hillyard Source: News Corp Australia 
THE NUMBER 
NORTH Melbourne v West Coast Eagles was the 15,000th VFL/AFL game of all-time. 
Jarrad Waite did his best to make it notable by kicking 1.7 during it. Thanks, Jarrad. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
